main event: A fireball-like object was seen by multiple observers in the Clovis, New Mexico area on December 22-23, 1963.
interesting points: The object was described as a round, reddish-orange fireball with flames or a trail of fire coming from the back.
The object was sighted at an elevation of around 45 degrees, traveling in a northeast direction at a speed less than 100 mph.
The object was visible for around 30 seconds before disappearing behind houses.
Multiple observers, including a flight test officer, a staff sergeant, and other local residents, reported seeing the object.
No sound was reported coming from the object, and it did not appear to have any discernible features or details other than the fire-like appearance.
witnesses: multiple observers including a flight test officer and staff sergeant
photographs: no, the report does not mention any photographs
